1.verse: Paul, a called apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God, and Sosthenes our brother,

2.verse: to the church of God being in Corinth, to ones having been sanctified in Christ Jesus, called saints, with all the ones calling-upon the name of our Lord Jesus Christ in every place, their Lord and ours:

3.verse: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

4.verse: I am giving-thanks to my God always for you for the grace of God having been given to you in Christ Jesus,

5.verse: because you were enriched in everything in Him— in all speech and all knowledge,

6.verse: even as the testimony of  Christ was confirmed in you—

7.verse: so that you are not lacking in any gift while eagerly-awaiting the revelation of our Lord Jesus Christ,

8.verse: Who also will confirm you until the end so as to be blameless on the day of our Lord Jesus Christ.

9.verse: God is faithful, through Whom you were called into fellowship with His Son, Jesus Christ our Lord.

10.verse: Brothers, Be of One Mind; Stop Dividing Over Your Leaders - Now I exhort you, brothers, by the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that you all be speaking the same thing, and that there not be divisions among you, but that you be made-complete in the same mind and in the same purpose.

11.verse: For it was made-clear to me concerning you, my brothers, by the ones of Chloe, that there are quarrels among you.

12.verse: Now I mean this: that each of you is saying “I am of Paul”, and “I of Apollos”, and “I of Cephas”, and “I of Christ”.

13.verse: Has Christ Been Divided? Were You Baptized Into Paul? Thankfully, I Did Not Baptize You! - Has Christ been divided? Paul was not crucified for you, was he? Or were you baptized in the name of Paul?

14.verse: I give-thanks to God that I baptized none of you, except Crispus and Gaius,

15.verse: so that no one may say that you were baptized in my name!

16.verse: Now I baptized also the household of Stephanas. As to the rest, I do not know if I baptized any other.

17.verse: For I Was Not Sent To Baptize, But To Announce The Gospel Without Wisdom of Speech - For Christ did not send me forth to be baptizing, but to be announcing-the-good-news— not in wisdom of speech, in order that the cross of Christ may not be made-empty.

18.verse: For God Intends The Gospel To Be Both Foolishness And Powerful - For the speech of the cross is foolishness to the ones perishing, but is the power of God to us being saved.

19.verse: For it has been written [in Isa 29:14]: “I will destroy the wisdom of the wise ones, and I will set-aside the intelligence of the intelligent ones”.

20.verse: Where is the wise one? Where is the scribe? Where is the debater of this age? Did not God make-foolish the wisdom of the world?

21.verse: For God Saves Those Who Believe The “Foolishness” of Christ Crucified - For since, in the wisdom of God, the world through its wisdom did not know God, God was well-pleased through the foolishness of  the proclamation to save the ones believing.

22.verse: Because indeed Jews are asking-for signs and Greeks are seeking wisdom,

23.verse: but we are proclaiming Christ crucified— to Jews, an offense; and to Gentiles, foolishness;

24.verse: but to the called ones themselves, both Jews and Greeks, Christ the power of God and the wisdom of God.

25.verse: Because the foolish thing of God is wiser than humans, and the weak thing of God is stronger than humans.

26.verse: God Chose To Save The Foolish And Weak To Shame Human Self-Effort - For look-at your calling, brothers— that there are not many wise according-to the flesh, not many powerful, not many well-born.

27.verse: But God chose the foolish things of the world in order that He might be putting the wise ones to shame. And God chose the weak things of the world in order that He might be putting the strong things to shame.

28.verse: And God chose the low-born things of the world, and the things having been treated-with-contempt— the things not being, in order that He might bring-to-nothing the things being,

29.verse: so that no flesh may boast in the sight of God.

30.verse: But by Him you are in Christ Jesus, Who became wisdom to us from God— both righteousness and holiness, and redemption—

31.verse: in order that just as it has been written [in Jer 9:24], “Let the one boasting be boasting in the Lord”.

1.verse: And I Came To You Proclaiming Christ Crucified Without Human Eloquence Or Wisdom - And I, having come to you, brothers, did not come in accordance with superiority of speech or of wisdom while proclaiming to you the mystery of God.

2.verse: For I determined not to know anything among you except Jesus Christ— and this One having been crucified.

3.verse: And I was with you in weakness and in fear and in much trembling.

4.verse: And my speech and my proclamation was not in persuasive words of wisdom, but in demonstration of  the Spirit and power,

5.verse: in order that your faith might not be in the wisdom of humans but in the power of God.

6.verse: Yet We Are Speaking God’s Wisdom To The Mature - Yet we are speaking wisdom among the mature, but a wisdom not of this age, nor of the rulers of this age— the ones being brought-to-nothing.

7.verse: Rather we are speaking God’s wisdom in a mystery; the wisdom having been hidden which God predestined before the ages for our glory,

8.verse: which none of the rulers of this age has understood. For if they had understood, they would not have crucified the Lord of glory.

9.verse: But it  is just as it has been written: “Things which an eye did not see and an ear did not hear, and which did not come-up on the heart of a human— which God prepared for the ones loving Him”.

10.verse: God Revealed This Wisdom To Us Through His Spirit - And God revealed it  to us through the Spirit. For the Spirit searches all things, even the deep things of God.

11.verse: For who among people knows the things of the person except the spirit of the person within him? In this manner also, no one has known the things of God except the Spirit of God.

12.verse: And we did not receive the spirit of the world, but the Spirit from God, in order that we might know the things having been freely-given to us by God—

13.verse: things which we also are speaking not in words taught by human wisdom, but in words taught by the Spirit, combining spiritual things with spiritual words.

14.verse: But a natural person does not accept the things of the Spirit of God. For they are foolishness to him and he is not able to understand, because they are spiritually examined.

15.verse: But the spiritual person examines all things, yet he himself is examined by no one.

16.verse: For “who knew the mind of the Lord? Who will instruct Him?” [Isa 40:13], and we have the mind of Christ!

1.verse: But You Are Still Acting Like Infants By Dividing Over Paul And Apollos - And I, brothers, was not able to speak to you as to spiritual ones, but as to ones made-of-flesh, as to infants in Christ.

2.verse: I gave you milk to drink, not food, for you were not yet able. But not-even still now are you able,

3.verse: for you are still fleshly. For where there is jealousy and strife among you, are you not fleshly and walking in accordance with human thinking?

4.verse: For whenever one says “I am of Paul”, and another “I am of Apollos”, are you not [mere] humans?

5.verse: So What Are Apollos And Paul? Servants Planting And Watering Seed For God - Therefore, what is Apollos? And what is Paul?— servants through whom you believed, even as the Lord gave to each one.

6.verse: I planted, Apollos watered, but God was causing-growth.

7.verse: So then neither is the one planting anything, nor the one watering, but God causing the growth.

8.verse: And the one planting and the one watering are one, but each will receive his own reward according to his own labor.

9.verse: We Are Workers In God’s Building. Be Careful How You Build On The Foundation - For we are God’s fellow-workers; you are God’s farm, God’s building.

10.verse: I laid a foundation according-to the grace of God having been given to me as a wise master-builder, and another is building-upon it. But let each one be watching-out how he builds-upon it.

11.verse: For no one can lay another foundation other than the one which is laid, which is Jesus Christ.

12.verse: And if one builds gold, silver, precious stones, wood, hay, straw upon the foundation,

13.verse: each one’s work will become evident. For the day will make it clear, because it is revealed by fire. And the fire itself will test what-sort each one’s work is.

14.verse: If one’s work which he built-upon it shall remain, he will receive a reward.

15.verse: If one’s work shall be burned-up, he will suffer-loss. But he himself will be saved, yet so as through fire.

16.verse: Do you not know that you are God’s temple and the Spirit of God is dwelling in you?

17.verse: If anyone ruins the temple of God, God will ruin this one. For the temple of God is holy— which you are!

18.verse: Don’t Be Deceived. The World’s Wisdom Is Foolishness To God - Let no one be deceiving himself. If anyone among you thinks that he is wise in this age, let him become foolish in order that he may become wise.

19.verse: For the wisdom of this world is foolishness with God. For it has been written [in Job 5:13], “He is the One catching the wise in their craftiness”;

20.verse: and again [in Ps 94:11], “The Lord knows the thoughts of the wise, that they are futile”.

21.verse: So Don’t Boast In People. All God’s Servants Belong To You - So then, let no one be boasting in people. For all things are yours—

22.verse: whether Paul or Apollos or Cephas or the world or life or death or things present or things coming— all things are yours.

23.verse: And you are Christ’s, and Christ is God’s.

1.verse: Consider Us As God’s Assistants And Stewards. Don’t Judge Anything Before The Time - Let a person be considering us in-this-manner: as attendants of Christ and stewards of the mysteries of God.

2.verse: Here, furthermore, it is sought in stewards that one be found faithful.

3.verse: Now to me, it is a very small thing that I should be examined by you, or by a human day of judgment. But I do not even examine myself !

4.verse: For I am conscious of nothing against myself, but I have not been declared-right by this, but the One examining me is the Lord.

5.verse: So then do not be judging anything before the time, until the Lord comes, Who will both illuminate the hidden things of the darkness and reveal the motives of the hearts. And at-that-time the praise will come to each one from God.

6.verse: Brothers, Learn From Apollos And Paul Not To Be Puffed Up About God’s Ministers - Now brothers, I applied these things to myself and Apollos for your sakes, in order that in us you might learn the saying “Do not go beyond the things which have been written”— in order that you might not be puffed-up, one on behalf of the one against the other.

7.verse: For who discerns you to be superior? And what do you have that you did not receive? But if indeed you received it, why do you boast as-though not having received it?

8.verse: For God Has Displayed Us Apostles As Last And Lowest In This World - You are already satisfied! You already became-rich! You became-kings without us! And o-that indeed you became-kings, in order that we also might reign with you.

9.verse: For I think God displayed us the apostles as last, like ones condemned-to-death— because we were-made a spectacle to the world, both to angels and to people.

10.verse: We are foolish ones for the sake of Christ, but you are wise ones in Christ. We are weak ones, but you are strong ones. You are distinguished ones, but we are dishonored ones.

11.verse: Until the present hour indeed we hunger, and thirst, and are naked, and are beaten, and live-transiently,

12.verse: and labor— working with our own hands.

13.verse: While being reviled, we bless; while being persecuted, we endure; while being slandered, we conciliate. We were-made like the sweepings of the world, the scum of all things, up to now.

14.verse: I Am Writing To Admonish You As My Children. Be Imitators of Me - I am writing these things not shaming you, but admonishing you as my beloved children.

15.verse: For if you should have ten-thousand tutors in Christ, yet you do not have many fathers. For I fathered you in Christ Jesus through the good-news.

16.verse: Therefore I exhort you— be imitators of me.

17.verse: For this reason I sent Timothy to you, who is my beloved and faithful child in the Lord, who will remind you as to my ways in Christ Jesus, just as I am teaching everywhere in every church.

18.verse: Now some were puffed-up as-if I were not coming to you.

19.verse: But I will come to you soon, if the Lord wills. And I shall come-to-know not the talk of the ones having been puffed-up, but the power.

20.verse: For the kingdom of God is not in talk, but in power.

21.verse: What do you want? Should I come to you with a rod, or with love and a spirit of gentleness?

1.verse: Remove Sexually Immoral People From Your Church: A Little Leaven Leavens The Lump - Sexual-immorality is actually being heard-of among you— and such sexual immorality which is not even among the Gentiles, that someone has the wife of his father.

2.verse: And you are puffed-up, and did not mourn instead, in order that the one having done this deed might be taken out of your midst.

3.verse: For indeed I, being absent in the body but present in the spirit, have already judged— as-though being present— the one having thus committed this thing.

4.verse: In the name of our Lord Jesus, you and my spirit having been gathered-together, with the power of our Lord Jesus,

5.verse: you are to hand-over such a one to Satan for the destruction of his flesh, in order that his spirit may be saved on the day of the Lord.

6.verse: Your boast is not good. Do you not know that a little leaven leavens the whole lump?

7.verse: Clean-out the old leaven, in order that you may be a new lump, just as you are unleavened. For indeed, our Passover [Lamb] was sacrificed— Christ.

8.verse: So then let us celebrate-the-feast not with old leaven, nor with the leaven of badness and evilness, but with the unleavened loaves of purity and truth.

9.verse: Do Not Even Associate With So-Called Brothers Who Continue To Disobey God - I wrote you in the letter not to associate-with sexually-immoral ones—

10.verse: not at-all meaning with the sexually-immoral ones of this world, or with the greedy and swindlers, or with idolaters, because then you would have to go out of the world!

11.verse: But now, I wrote to you not to associate-with them if anyone being named a brother should be a sexually-immoral one, or a greedy one, or an idolater, or a reviler, or a drunkard, or a swindler— not even to eat with such a one.

12.verse: For what do I have to do with judging the ones outside? Are you not judging the ones inside?

13.verse: But God judges the ones outside. Remove the evil one from-among you yourselves.

1.verse: Take Your Disputes With Brothers To Wise Judges In The Church, Not To The World’s Courts - Does any one of you, having a matter against the other, dare to go-to-court before the unrighteous ones, and not before the saints?

2.verse: Or do you not know that the saints will judge the world? And if the world is judged by you, are you unworthy of the smallest cases?

3.verse: Do you not know that we will judge angels? Shall I not-indeed mention things-pertaining-to-this-life?

4.verse: So indeed, if you have cases pertaining-to-this-life, are you seating these [as judges]— the ones having been of-no-account in the church?

5.verse: I say this to your shame. So is there not among you anyone wise who will be able to discern between his brother and this brother?—

6.verse: but brother is going-to-court against brother, and this before unbelievers?

7.verse: Better To Be Wronged Than To Wrong Your Brother With a Lawsuit - So indeed, it is already actually a defeat for you that you have lawsuits with each other. Why not rather be wronged? Why not rather be defrauded?

8.verse: But you are wronging and defrauding— and this [your own] brothers!

9.verse: Wrongdoers Will Not Inherit The Kingdom. But You Were Cleansed of Such Things - Or do you not know that wrongdoers will not inherit God’s kingdom? Do not be deceived. Neither sexually-immoral ones, nor idolaters, nor adulterers, nor homo-erotic-partners, nor homosexuals,

10.verse: nor thieves, nor greedy ones— not drunkards, not revilers, not swindlers— will inherit the kingdom of God.

11.verse: And some of you were these things. But you washed-them-away, but you were sanctified, but you were declared-righteous in the name of the Lord Jesus Christ and in the Spirit of our God.

12.verse: Do Not Be Sexually Immoral - “All things are lawful to me”, but not all things are beneficial. “All things are lawful to me”, but I will not be mastered by any.

13.verse: Foods are for the stomach and the stomach for foods. But God will do-away-with both this and these. But the body is not for sexual-immorality, but for the Lord, and the Lord is for the body.

14.verse: And God both raised the Lord and will raise us up by His power.

15.verse: Your Bodies Are Body-Parts of Christ: Flee Sexual Immorality - Do you not know that your bodies are body-parts of Christ? Therefore, having taken-away the body-parts of Christ, shall I make them body-parts of a prostitute? May it never be!

16.verse: Or do you not know that the one joining himself to a prostitute is one body with her? For He says [in Gen 2:24] “the two will be one flesh”.

17.verse: But the one joining himself to the Lord is one spirit with Him.

18.verse: Be fleeing sexual immorality. Your Body Is The Temple of The Holy Spirit. Glorify God In Your Body -Every sin which a person may do is outside the body. But the one committing-sexual-immorality is sinning against his own body.

19.verse: Or do you not know that your body is the temple of the Holy Spirit in you, Whom you have from God? And you are not your own,

20.verse: for you were bought with a price. Therefore glorify God in your body.

1.verse: Answers To Your Questions: - Now concerning the things which you wrote— Concerning Marriage And Singleness: Live According To Your Gift From God -It is good for a man not to touch a woman.

2.verse: But because of sexual-immoralities, let each man have his own wife, and let each woman have her own husband.

3.verse: Let the husband give-back to his wife her due, and likewise also the wife to her husband.

4.verse: The wife does not have-authority over her own body, but the husband does. And likewise also the husband does not have-authority over his own body, but the wife does.

5.verse: Do not be depriving one another— except perhaps by agreement, for a time, in order that you may devote-yourselves to prayer and [then] be together again— in order that Satan may not tempt you because of your lack-of-self-control.

6.verse: But I am saying this by way of concession, not by way of command.

7.verse: And I wish that all people were as indeed myself! But each has his own gift from God— one in this manner and another in this manner.

8.verse: And I say to the unmarried and the widows— it is good for them if they remain as I also am.

9.verse: But if they do not have-self-control, let them marry. For it is better to marry than to be burning.

10.verse: But Do Not Divorce Your Christian Spouse - But to the ones having married I command (not I, but the Lord), that a wife not be separated from her husband—

11.verse: but if indeed she is separated, let her remain unmarried or let her be reconciled to her husband— and that a husband not leave his wife.

12.verse: Do Not Divorce an Unbelieving Spouse Who Chooses To Stay - But to the rest I say, not the Lord— if any brother has an unbelieving wife and this one consents to dwell with him, let him not leave her.

13.verse: And if any woman has an unbelieving husband and this one consents to dwell with her, let her not leave her husband.

14.verse: For the unbelieving husband has been sanctified by his wife. And the unbelieving wife has been sanctified by the brother. Otherwise then your children are unclean, but now they are holy.

15.verse: But if the unbelieving one separates, let such a one separate. The brother or the sister has not been enslaved by such things, but God has called you in peace.

16.verse: For how do you know, wife, whether you will save your husband? Or how do you know, husband, whether you will save your wife?

17.verse: Except that as the Lord apportioned to each one, as God has called each one, in this manner let him be walking. And thus I am directing in all the churches.

18.verse: In General, Remain With God In The Life Context In Which You Were Saved - Was anyone called having been circumcised? Let him not conceal it. Has anyone been called in uncircumcision? Let him not be circumcised.

19.verse: Circumcision is nothing and uncircumcision is nothing, but the keeping of the commandments of God.

20.verse: Each in the calling in which he was called— in this let him remain.

21.verse: Were you called as a slave? Do not let it be a concern to you. But if also you are able to become free, rather make-use-of the opportunity.

22.verse: For the one having been called in the Lord as a slave is a freedperson of the Lord. Likewise the one having been called as a free one is a slave of Christ.

23.verse: You were bought with a price; do not become slaves of people.

24.verse: Each in what he was called, brothers— in this let him remain with God.

25.verse: Concerning The Unmarried: In General, It Is Good To Remain As You Are In Life - Now concerning virgins, I do not have a command from the Lord, but I am giving an opinion as one having been shown-mercy by the Lord to be trustworthy.

26.verse: I think then that this is good because of the present necessity, that it is good for a person to be so.

27.verse: Have you been bound to a woman? Do not be seeking a release. Have you been released from a woman? Do not be seeking a wife.

28.verse: But even if you marry, you did not sin. And if the virgin marries, she did not sin. But such ones will have affliction in the flesh, and I am sparing you.

29.verse: We All Must Keep Our Earthly Life In Eternal Perspective - And this I say, brothers— the time is shortened, so that henceforth even the ones having wives should be as-though not having,

30.verse: and the ones weeping as-though not weeping, and the ones rejoicing as-though not rejoicing, and the ones buying as-though not holding-on-to,

31.verse: and the ones making-use-of the world as-though not making-full-use-of it. For the form of this world is passing away.

32.verse: Single People Can Be Solely Devoted To God; The Married Have a Dual Concern - Now I want you to be free-from-concern. The unmarried man is concerned-about the things of the Lord— how he may please the Lord.

33.verse: But the man having married is concerned-about the things of the world— how he may please his wife,

34.verse: and he has been divided. And the unmarried woman, and the virgin, is concerned-about the things of the Lord— that she may be holy both in the body and in the spirit. But the woman having married is concerned-about the things of the world— how she may please her husband.

35.verse: Do What You Think Is Honorable For Your Virgin Daughter - Now I am saying this for the benefit of you yourselves— not that I may throw a noose on you, but toward good-order and devotion to the Lord, undistractedly.

36.verse: But if one thinks that he is behaving-dishonorably toward his virgin daughter— if she is beyond-the-bloom-of-youth, and it ought to be so— let him do what he wants. He is not sinning. Let them marry.

37.verse: But he who stands steadfast in his heart, not having a necessity, and has authority concerning his own will, and has determined this in his own heart, to keep his virgin daughter— he will do well.

38.verse: So then, both the one giving his virgin daughter in marriage is doing well, and the one not giving-in-marriage will do better.

39.verse: Widows Are Free To Remarry, But May Be Happier Remaining As They Are - A wife has been bound for as much time as her husband lives. But if her husband falls-asleep, she is free to be married to whom she wishes— only in the Lord.

40.verse: But she is happier if she remains thus, according to my opinion; and I also think that I have the Spirit of God.

1.verse: Concerning Food Sacrificed To Idols: Let Love Guide Your Exercise of “Rights” - Now concerning the foods-sacrificed-to-idols, we know that we all have knowledge. Knowledge puffs-up, but love builds-up.

2.verse: If anyone thinks that he has come-to-know anything, he did not-yet know as he ought-to know.

3.verse: But if one loves God, this one has been known by Him.

4.verse: Therefore concerning the eating of the foods-sacrificed-to-idols— we know that an idol is nothing in the world, and that there is no God except one.

5.verse: For even if-indeed there are ones being called gods, whether in heaven or on earth— as-indeed there are many gods and many lords—

6.verse: yet for us there is One God the Father, from Whom are all things, and we are for Him; and one Lord Jesus Christ, through Whom are all things, and we are through Him.

7.verse: But this knowledge is not in all people. But some, by the accustomed-habit of the idol until now, eat this food as food-sacrificed-to-an-idol. And their conscience, being weak, is stained.

8.verse: But food will not bring us near to God— neither if we do not eat are we lacking, nor if we eat are we abounding.

9.verse: But be watching-out that this right of yours does not somehow become an opportunity-for-stumbling to the weak ones.

10.verse: For if someone sees you, the one having knowledge, reclining [to eat] in an idol-temple, will not his conscience, being weak, be built-up so as to eat the foods-sacrificed-to-idols?

11.verse: For the one being weak is being destroyed by your knowledge— the brother for the sake of whom Christ died!

12.verse: And in this manner sinning against the brothers and striking their conscience while being weak, you are sinning against Christ.

13.verse: On The One Hand, I Will Not Do Anything That Hinders People’s Spiritual Advance - For-this-very-reason, if food causes my brother to fall, I will never eat meats, ever— in-order-that I may not cause my brother to fall.

1.verse: For Example, I Have The Right To Be Paid As God’s Workman - Am I not free? Am I not an apostle? Have I not seen Jesus our Lord? Are you not my work in the Lord?

2.verse: If to others I am not an apostle, yet indeed I am to you. For you are the seal of my apostleship in the Lord—

3.verse: this is my defense to the ones examining me!

4.verse: We do not fail to have the right to eat and drink, do we?

5.verse: We do not fail to have the right to take along a sister who is a wife, do we?— as also the other apostles, and the brothers of the Lord, and Cephas.

6.verse: Or I alone and Barnabas— do not we have the right not to be working?

7.verse: Workers Always Partake of The Fruit of Their Labors - Who ever serves-as-a-soldier with his own rations? Who plants a vineyard and does not eat the fruit of it? Or who shepherds a flock and does not eat of the milk of the flock?

8.verse: Does Not The Law Say This Very Thing? - I am not speaking these things according to [mere] human thinking, am I ? Or does not the Law also say these things?

9.verse: For in the Law of Moses it has been written [in Deut 25:4], “You shall not muzzle a threshing ox”. God is not concerned about the oxen, is He?

10.verse: Or is He surely speaking for our sake? Indeed it was written for our sake— because the one plowing ought to plow on the basis of hope, and the one threshing to thresh on the basis of hope that he might partake.

11.verse: I Do Have This Right Over You - If we sowed spiritual things to you, is it a great thing if we shall reap fleshly things from you?

12.verse: If others partake of this right over you, should we not more? But I Chose Not To Make Use Of This Right So As Not To Hinder The Gospel -Nevertheless, we did not make-use-of  this right. But we are bearing all things, in order that we might not give any hindrance to the good-news of Christ.

13.verse: The Lord Even Commanded That Gospel Workers Live By Their Work - Do you not know that the ones working the temple-duties eat the things from the temple, that the ones serving at the altar divide-a-share with the altar?

14.verse: So also the Lord directed the ones proclaiming the good-news to be living from the good-news.

15.verse: But My Boast Is That I Do Not Make Use of This Right - But I have not made-use-of any of these things. And I did not write these things in order that it might become so in my case, for it would be better for me to die rather than— no one shall empty my boast!

16.verse: For if I am announcing-the-good-news, it is not a boast for me, for a necessity is lying-upon me; for woe is to me if I do not announce-the-good-news.

17.verse: For if I am practicing this of-my-own-will, I have a reward; but if not-of-my-own-will, I have been entrusted a stewardship.

18.verse: What then is my reward? That while announcing-the-good-news, I might place the good-news free-of-charge, so as not to make-full-use-of my right in the good-news.

19.verse: For I Have Chosen To Enslave Myself To All For The Advance of The Gospel - For while being free from all people, I enslaved myself to all in order that I might gain the more.

20.verse: Indeed I became to the Jews as a Jew, in order that I might gain Jews; to the ones under the Law, as under the Law— not being myself under the Law— in order that I might gain the ones under the Law;

21.verse: to the ones without-the-Law, as without-the-Law— not being without-the-law of God, but within-the-law of Christ— in order that I might gain the ones without-the-Law.

22.verse: I became weak to the weak, in order that I might gain the weak. I have become all things to all people, in order that I might by all means save some.

23.verse: And I am doing all things for the sake of the good-news, in order that I might become a co-partner of it.

24.verse: On The Other Hand, I Will Do Everything Needed To Win My Race And Keep My Prize - Do you not know that the ones running in a race all run, but one receives the prize? Be running in this manner: that you may take-hold-of the prize.

25.verse: And everyone competing exercises-self-control as to all things. So those do it in order that they might receive a decayable crown, but we an undecayable one.

26.verse: So-indeed I run in this manner, as not aimlessly. I box in this manner, as not beating the air.

27.verse: But I bruise my body and make it my slave, that having proclaimed to others, I myself should not somehow become disapproved.

1.verse: For Loss of The Prize Is Possible: Remember What Happened To Israel - For I do not want you to be unaware, brothers, that our fathers were all under the cloud, and all went through the sea,

2.verse: and all were baptized into Moses in the cloud and in the sea,

3.verse: and all ate the same spiritual food,

4.verse: and all drank the same spiritual drink. For they were drinking from a spiritual rock following them. And the rock was Christ.

5.verse: But God was not well-pleased with the majority of them, for they were strewn in the wilderness.

6.verse: Do Not Follow Their Example - Now these things took place as our examples, so that we might not be desirers of evil things, as those also desired.

7.verse: And do not be idolaters, as some of them, as-indeed it has been written [in Ex 32:6], “The people sat-down to eat and drink, and stood up to play”.

8.verse: And let us not be committing-sexual-immorality, as some of them committed sexual immorality, and twenty three thousand fell in one day [Num 25:1-9].

9.verse: And let us not be putting Christ to the test, as some of them tested, and were being destroyed by the serpents [Num 21:5-6].

10.verse: And do not be grumbling, like some of them grumbled, and perished by the destroyer [Num 16:41-49].

11.verse: Now these things were happening to those ones as-an-example. And it was written for our admonition, on whom the ends of the ages have come.

12.verse: So Watch Out That You Do Not Fall - So then let the one thinking that he stands be watching-out that he may not fall.

13.verse: A temptation has not seized you except what is common-to-humanity. And God is faithful, Who will not allow you to be tempted beyond what you are able, but also with the temptation will make the way-out, that you may be able to endure.

14.verse: For This Very Reason, Flee From The Eating Connected With Idol Worship - For-this-very-reason, my beloved, be fleeing from idolatry.

15.verse: I speak as to wise ones; you judge what I say:

16.verse: the cup of blessing which we bless, is it not a sharing of the blood of Christ? The bread which we break, is it not a sharing of the body of Christ?

17.verse: Because there is one bread, we the many are one body, for we all partake from the one bread.

18.verse: Look-at Israel according to the flesh— are not the ones eating the sacrifices sharers of the altar?

19.verse: Therefore what am I saying? That food-sacrificed-to-an-idol is anything, or that an idol is anything?

20.verse: On the contrary, that the things which they are sacrificing, they are sacrificing to demons, and not to God. And I do not want you to be sharers of the demons.

21.verse: You cannot drink the Lord’s cup and the demons’ cup. You cannot partake of the Lord’s table and the demons’ table.

22.verse: Or do we provoke the Lord to jealousy? We are not stronger than He, are we?

23.verse: So As To The Eating of Meat, Do What Is Beneficial And Edifying To Those Eating - All things are lawful, but not all things are beneficial. All things are lawful, but not all things build-up.

24.verse: Let no one be seeking his own thing, but the thing of the other.

25.verse: Be eating anything being sold in the meat-market, examining nothing for the sake of conscience.

26.verse: For “The earth and the fullness of it are the Lord’s” [Ps 24:1].

27.verse: If one of the unbelievers invites you, and you want to go, eat anything being set-before you, examining nothing for the sake of conscience.

28.verse: But if one should say to you “This is offered-in-sacrifice”, do not eat— for the sake of that one having disclosed it, and the conscience.

29.verse: Now the conscience I mean is not the one of oneself, but the one of the other. For why is my freedom being judged by another’s conscience?

30.verse: If I am partaking with thanks, why am I being blasphemed for that which I am giving-thanks?

31.verse: In Summary, Do All For God’s Glory. Be Blameless To All And Seek Their Benefit - Therefore, whether you are eating or drinking or doing anything, be doing all for the glory of God.

32.verse: Be blameless both to Jews and Greeks, and to the church of God—

33.verse: just as I also am pleasing all people as to all things, not seeking the benefit of myself, but the benefit of the many, in order that they might be saved.

1.verse: Be imitators of me, just as I also am of Christ.

2.verse: Concerning The Wearing of Veils In Public: God Has Established Heads of Authority - Now I praise you because you have remembered me as to everything, and you are holding-on-to the traditions, just as I delivered to you.

3.verse: And I want you to know that Christ is the head of every man, and the husband is the head of a wife, and God is the head of Christ.

4.verse: Do Not Shame Your Head By How You Dress - Every man praying or prophesying while having a covering down over his head is shaming his head.

5.verse: And every woman praying or prophesying with the head unveiled is shaming her head, for she is one and the same with the one having been shaved.

6.verse: For if a woman is not veiling-herself , let her also have-herself-sheared. But if it is shameful for a woman to have-herself-sheared or shaved, let her be veiling-herself.

7.verse: For a man ought not to be veiling the head, being the image and glory of God— but the woman is the glory of man.

8.verse: For man is not from woman, but woman from man.

9.verse: For indeed man was not created for the sake of the woman, but woman for the sake of the man.

10.verse: For this reason, the woman ought to be having authority on her head because of the angels.

11.verse: Nevertheless there is neither woman without man, nor man without woman in the Lord.

12.verse: For just as the woman is from the man, so also the man is through the woman. And all things are from God.

13.verse: Judge Among Yourselves Whether It Is Fitting To Ignore The Customs of The Churches - Judge among you yourselves— is it fitting that an unveiled woman should pray to God?

14.verse: Does not even nature itself teach you that if a man has long hair, it is a dishonor to him—

15.verse: but if a woman has long hair, it is a glory to her? Because the long hair has been given to her for a covering.

16.verse: But if anyone seems to be contentious, we do not have such a custom, nor do the churches of God.

17.verse: Concerning The Lord’s Supper: Your Supper Is Unworthy of The Name - But while commanding this, I do not praise— because you are coming-together not for the better, but for the worse.

18.verse: For first, while you are coming-together in church, I am hearing that there are divisions among you. And a certain part of it I believe—

19.verse: for there indeed have-to be factions among you in order that the approved ones may also become known among you.

20.verse: So while you are coming-together at the same place, it is not that you may eat the Lord’s Supper!

21.verse: For at the eating, each one is taking his own dinner before others. And one is hungry, and another is drunk.

22.verse: You do not indeed fail to have houses for eating and drinking, do you? Or are you treating the church of God with contempt, and humiliating the ones not having? What should I say to you? Shall I praise you? In this I do not praise.

23.verse: The Lord’s Supper Is a Remembrance of What He Did For Us - For I received from the Lord what I also handed-over to you— that the Lord Jesus, in the night on which He was being handed-over, took bread.

24.verse: And having given-thanks, He broke it and said “This is My body, the one being given for you. Be doing this for My remembrance”.

25.verse: Similarly also the cup after the dining, saying, “This cup is the new covenant in My blood. Be doing this, as-often-as you drink it, for My remembrance”.

26.verse: For as-often-as you eat this bread and drink the cup, you are proclaiming the death of the Lord, until which time He comes.

27.verse: So Don’t Partake of It In a Manner Unworthy of What He Did: Examine Yourselves - So then, whoever eats the bread or drinks the cup of the Lord unworthily shall be guilty of the body and the blood of the Lord.

28.verse: But let a person examine himself, and in this manner let him eat of the bread and drink of the cup.

29.verse: For the one eating and drinking while not rightly-judging the body is eating and drinking judgment on himself.

30.verse: For this reason many among you are weak and sick, and many sleep.

31.verse: But if we were rightly-judging ourselves, we would not be being judged.

32.verse: But while being judged, we are being disciplined by the Lord in-order-that we might not be condemned with the world.

33.verse: Partake of It Together With Proper Respect For One Another - So then, my brothers, while coming-together so as to eat, be waiting-for one another.

34.verse: If one is hungry, let him eat at home, in-order-that you might not come-together for judgment. And I will set-in-order the remaining things whenever I come.

1.verse: Concerning Spiritual Gifts: God Distributes a Variety of Gifts For Our Mutual Benefit - Now concerning the spiritual gifts, brothers, I do not want you to be unaware.

2.verse: You know that when you were Gentiles, you were being led-away to the speechless idols, however you were being led.

3.verse: Therefore I make-known to you that no one speaking by the Spirit of God is saying “Jesus is accursed”. And no one is able to say “Jesus is Lord” except by the Holy Spirit.

4.verse: Now there are differences of gifts, but the same Spirit.

5.verse: And there are differences of ministries, and the same Lord.

6.verse: And there are differences of things-worked, but the same God working all things in all persons.

7.verse: And the manifestation of  the Spirit is given to each one for our benefit.

8.verse: For to one a word of  wisdom is given through the Spirit; and to another, a word of knowledge according-to the same Spirit;

9.verse: to a different one, faith by the same Spirit; and to another, gifts of  healings by the one Spirit;

10.verse: and to another, things-worked by miracles; and to another, prophecy; and to another, discernments of spirits; to a different one, kinds of tongues; and to another, interpretation of tongues.

11.verse: But the one and the same Spirit works all these things, distributing to each one individually, just as He wills.

12.verse: For The Body of Christ Is Like The Human Body - For just as the [human] body is one [body]; and it has many body-parts; and all the body-parts of the [human] body, being many, are one body; so also is Christ.

13.verse: It Is One Body With One Spirit - For indeed with one Spirit, we all were baptized into one body— whether Jews or Greeks, whether slaves or free. And we all were given one Spirit to drink.

14.verse: It Has Many Body Parts Placed By God - For indeed the body is not one body-part, but many.

15.verse: If the foot should say “Because I am not a hand, I am not a part of the body”, it is not for this reason not a part of the body.

16.verse: And if the ear should say “Because I am not an eye, I am not a part of the body”, it is not for this reason not a part of the body.

17.verse: If the whole body were an eye, where would the hearing be? If the whole were an ear, where would the smelling be?

18.verse: But now, God placed the body-parts— each one of them— in the body, just as He wanted.

19.verse: And if all were one body-part, where would the body be?

20.verse: All Body Parts Are Needed For The Healthy Functioning of The One Body - But now, there are many body-parts— but one body!

21.verse: And the eye cannot say to the hand, “I do not have need of you”. Or again the head to the feet, “I do not have need of you”.

22.verse: On the contrary, much rather the body-parts of the body seeming to be weaker are necessary.

23.verse: And the things of the body which we are thinking to be more-without-honor, on these we are putting-on more honor. Indeed our private parts have more presentability,

24.verse: but our presentable parts have no need. But God blended-together the body, having given more honor to the body-part lacking,

25.verse: in order that there should not be division in the body, but that the body-parts should be having the same concern for one another.

26.verse: And if one body-part is suffering, all the body-parts are suffering-with it. If one body-part is being glorified, all the body-parts are rejoicing-with it.

27.verse: You Are The Parts of Christ’s Body, Placed Where You Are By God - And you are the body of Christ, and body-parts in part.

28.verse: And God placed some in the church as first, apostles; second, prophets; third, teachers; then miracles; then gifts of healings, helps, administrations, kinds of tongues.

29.verse: All are not apostles, are they? All are not prophets, are they? All are not teachers, are they? All do not do miracles, do they?

30.verse: All do not have gifts of healings, do they? All do not speak in tongues, do they? All do not interpret, do they?

31.verse: But be zealous-for the greater gifts. The Value of Your God-Given Gift Is Measured By Your Love -And I show you a way still beyond measure:

1.verse: If I speak in the tongues of humans and of angels, but I do not have love, I have become a sounding brass [gong] or a clanging cymbal.

2.verse: And if I have prophecy and know all mysteries and all knowledge, and if I have all faith so as to remove mountains, but I do not have love, I am nothing.

3.verse: And if I dole-out all my possessions, and if I hand-over my body so that I may boast, but I do not have love, I am profited nothing.

4.verse: The Way Love Behaves - Love is patient. Love shows-kindness. Love does not envy, does not brag, is not puffed-up,

5.verse: does not behave-dishonorably, does not seek its own things, is not provoked, does not count the bad,

6.verse: does not rejoice over unrighteousness, but rejoices-with the truth,

7.verse: bears all things, believes all things, hopes all things, endures all things.

8.verse: Love Is Permanent; Gifts Are Temporary. Be Pursuing Love - Love never fails. But if there are prophecies, they will be set-aside. If there are tongues, they will cease. If there is knowledge, it will be set-aside.

9.verse: For we know in part, and we prophesy in part—

10.verse: but when the complete thing comes, the thing in part will be set-aside.

11.verse: When I was a child, I was speaking like a child, thinking like a child, counting like a child— when I have become a man, I have set-aside the things of the child.

12.verse: For now we are seeing through a mirror, in an enigma— but then face to face. Now I know in part— but then I will know-fully, just as I also was fully-known.

13.verse: But now these three are remaining— faith, hope, love. But love is the greater of these.

1.verse: Be pursuing love. Be Zealous For Spiritual Gifts, But Especially To Prophesy And Edify The Church -Now be zealous-for the spiritual gifts, but even-more that you might be prophesying.

2.verse: For the one speaking in a tongue is not speaking to people, but to God— for no one hears, but he speaks mysteries with his spirit.

3.verse: But the one prophesying is speaking edification and exhortation and consolation to people.

4.verse: The one speaking in a tongue is edifying himself , but the one prophesying is edifying the church.

5.verse: And I wish that you all were speaking in tongues, but even-more that you might be prophesying. But the one prophesying is greater than one speaking in tongues— unless he interprets in order that the church may receive edification.

6.verse: Speaking In Tongues Is Just Speaking Into The Air Unless It Is Understood - But now, brothers, if I come to you speaking in tongues, what will I profit you unless I speak to you either by a revelation or by knowledge or by a prophecy or by a teaching?

7.verse: Likewise the lifeless things giving a sound— whether a flute or harp— if it does not give a distinction in the tones, how will the thing being fluted or the thing being harped be known?

8.verse: For indeed, if a trumpet gives an uncertain sound, who will prepare himself for battle?

9.verse: So also you with the tongue— if you do not give a clear word, how will the thing being spoken be known? For you will be speaking into the air!

10.verse: There are perhaps so-many kinds of spoken sounds in the world, and none is meaningless.

11.verse: If then I do not know the force of the spoken sound, I will be a barbarian to the one speaking, and the one speaking a barbarian with me.

12.verse: So also you— since you are zealots for spiritual gifts, be seeking that you may abound for the edification of the church.

13.verse: So In Church, Tongues Must Be Interpreted If The Hearers Are To Be Edified - Therefore let the one speaking in a tongue pray in order that he might interpret.

14.verse: For if I am praying in a tongue, my spirit is praying, but my mind is unfruitful.

15.verse: What then is to be done? I will pray with the spirit, and I will also pray with the mind. I will sing-praise with the spirit, and I will also sing-praise with the mind.

16.verse: Otherwise, if you are blessing with your spirit [only], how will the one filling the place of the uninstructed say the “Amen” at your thanksgiving, since he does not know what you are saying?

17.verse: For you are giving-thanks well— but the other person is not being edified.

18.verse: I give-thanks to God I speak in tongues more than all of you.

19.verse: But in church, I want to speak five words with my mind in order that I might also instruct others, rather than ten-thousand words in a tongue.

20.verse: Tongues Are a Sign For Unbelievers; Prophecy Is For Believers - Brothers, do not be children in your understanding. But be childlike in evilness, and be mature in your understanding.

21.verse: It has been written in the Law [in Isa 28:11-12] that “I will speak to this people by people of other-tongues, and by the lips of others. And not even in this manner will they listen-to Me, says the Lord”.

22.verse: So then the tongues are for a sign— not for the ones believing, but for the unbelievers. But the prophecy is not for the unbelievers, but for the ones believing.

23.verse: So In Church, Tongues Not Understood Breed Confusion. Prophecy Edifies - Therefore, if the whole church comes-together at the same place, and they all speak in tongues, and uninstructed ones or unbelievers come-in, will they not say that you are mad?

24.verse: But if they all prophesy, and some unbeliever or an uninstructed one comes in, he is convicted by all. He is examined by all.

25.verse: The hidden things of his heart become evident. And thus, having fallen on his face, he will give-worship to God, declaring that God is really among you.

26.verse: Brothers, Organize Your Church Service For Edification - What then is to be done, brothers? Whenever you come-together, each one has a psalm, has a teaching, has a revelation, has a tongue, has an interpretation. Let all things be done for edification.

27.verse: If anyone speaks in a tongue, let it be done by two or at the most three, and in turn, and let one person interpret.

28.verse: But if  there is no interpreter, let him be silent in church. And let him speak to himself  and to God.

29.verse: And let two or three prophets speak, and let the others discern.

30.verse: But if a prophecy is revealed to another being seated, let the first be silent.

31.verse: For you can all prophesy individually, in order that all may learn, and all may be exhorted.

32.verse: And the spirits of prophets are subject to prophets.

33.verse: For God is not the God of disorder, but of peace. This Also Includes Women Being Quiet During The Church Service -As in all the churches of the saints,

34.verse: let the women be silent in the churches. For it is not permitted for them to speak. But let them be subject, just as the Law also says.

35.verse: And if they want to learn anything, let them question their own husbands at home. For it is shameful for a woman to speak in church.

36.verse: These Instructions Are The Lord’s Commandments - Or did the word of God go-forth from you? Or did it reach to you only?

37.verse: If anyone thinks that he is a prophet or a spiritual person, let him acknowledge the things which I am writing to you— that they are a commandment of the Lord.

38.verse: But if anyone does not-know this, he is not-known.

39.verse: Summary - So then, my brothers, be zealous-for the prophesying. And do not be forbidding the speaking in tongues.

40.verse: But let all things be done properly, and in accordance with order.

1.verse: Concerning The Resurrection: Christ Was Raised From The Dead And Seen By Many - Now I make-known to you, brothers, the good-news which I announced-as-good-news to you, which you also received, in which you also stand,

2.verse: through which you also are being saved— if  you are holding-on in that message I announced-as-good-news to you, unless you believed in-vain.

3.verse: For I delivered to you among the first things what I also received: that Christ died for our sins in accordance with the Scriptures,

4.verse: and that He was buried, and that He has been raised on the third day in accordance with the Scriptures,

5.verse: and that He appeared to Cephas, then to the twelve.

6.verse: After that He appeared to over five-hundred brothers at-one-time, of whom the majority are remaining until now. But some fell-asleep.

7.verse: After that He appeared to James, then to all the apostles.

8.verse: And last of all, as-if-indeed to the untimely-born one, He appeared to me also.

9.verse: For I am the least of the apostles— who am not fit to be called an apostle, because I persecuted the church of God.

10.verse: But by the grace of God I am what I am. And His grace toward me did not become empty. But I labored even more than them all— yet not I, but the grace of God with me.

11.verse: So whether it was I or those, thus we are proclaiming, and thus you believed.

12.verse: So If Christ Was Raised, Why Do Some of You Say There Is No Resurrection? - But if Christ is being proclaimed that He has been raised from the dead, how is it some are saying among you that there is no resurrection of dead ones?

13.verse: If The Dead Are Not Raised, Christ Was Not Raised, And Your Faith Is Futile - Now if there is no resurrection of dead ones, neither has Christ been raised.

14.verse: And if Christ has not been raised, then our proclamation is also empty; your faith is also empty;

15.verse: and we are even found to be false-witnesses of  God, because we testified against God that He did raise Christ— Whom He did not raise if-indeed then dead ones are not raised.

16.verse: For if dead ones are not raised, neither has Christ been raised.

17.verse: And if Christ has not been raised, your faith is futile. You are still in your sins.

18.verse: Then also the ones having fallen-asleep in Christ perished.

19.verse: If we are ones having hoped in Christ in this life only, we are more pitiable than all people.

20.verse: But Christ Has Been Raised As The Firstfruit of Those Yet To Be Raised - But now, Christ has been raised from the dead— the firstfruit of the ones having fallen-asleep.

21.verse: For since death came through a man, the resurrection of dead ones also came through a man.

22.verse: For just as in Adam all die, so also in Christ all will be given-life,

23.verse: but each in his own order: Christ the firstfruit; after-that the ones of  Christ at His coming.

24.verse: Then comes the end— when He hands-over the kingdom to His God and Father, when He has abolished all rule and all authority and power.

25.verse: For He must reign until which time He has put all the enemies under His feet.

26.verse: Death, the last enemy, is abolished—

27.verse: for “He subjected all things under His feet” [Ps 8:6]. But when He says that “All things have been subjected”, it is clear that this is except the One having subjected all things to Him.

28.verse: But when all things are subjected to Him, then the Son Himself also will be subjected to the One having subjected all things to Him, in order that God may be all things in all.

29.verse: Otherwise, Why Be Concerned About The Dead Or Risk Our Lives? - Otherwise, what will the ones being baptized for the dead do? If dead ones are not raised at-all, why indeed are they baptized for them?

30.verse: Why indeed are we in danger every hour?

31.verse: I die daily— by your boasting, brothers, which I have in Christ Jesus our Lord.

32.verse: If in accordance with human thinking I fought-wild-animals at Ephesus, what is the profit to me? If dead ones are not raised, “Let us eat and drink, for tomorrow we die” [Isa 22:13].

33.verse: Don’t Be Deceived. Sober Up - Do not be deceived: bad companionships corrupt good habits.

34.verse: Sober-up righteously and do not be sinning, for some have an ignorance of God. I speak to your shame.

35.verse: How Are The Dead Raised, And With What Kind of Body? - But someone will say, “How are the dead raised? And with what kind of body do they come?”

36.verse: What You Sow Must Die, And Then God Gives It New Life In a Different Body - Foolish one! What you sow is not given-life unless it dies.

37.verse: And as to what you sow— you do not sow the body which will come, but a bare seed, perhaps of wheat or of some of the rest.

38.verse: And God gives it a body just as He willed— indeed, to each of the seeds its own body.

39.verse: Not all flesh is the same flesh. But there is one of humans, and another flesh of livestock, and another flesh of birds, and another of fish.

40.verse: And there are heavenly bodies and earthly bodies. But the glory of the heavenly is one kind, and the glory of the earthly is different.

41.verse: There is one glory of the sun, and another glory of the moon, and another glory of the stars. For star differs from star in glory.

42.verse: So Also Is The Resurrection of The Dead. We Are Raised In a Heavenly Body - So also is the resurrection of the dead. It is sown in decay; it is raised in undecayability.

43.verse: It is sown in dishonor; it is raised in glory. It is sown in weakness; it is raised in power.

44.verse: It is sown a natural body; it is raised a spiritual body. If there is a natural body, there is also a spiritual body.

45.verse: So also it has been written [in Gen 2:7], “The first man, Adam, became a living soul”. The Last Adam became a life-giving spirit.

46.verse: But the spiritual body is not first— but the natural body, then the spiritual.

47.verse: The first man was from earth, made-of-dust. The second Man is from heaven.

48.verse: Such as was the one made-of-dust— such ones also are the ones made-of-dust. And such as is the heavenly One— such ones also are the heavenly ones.

49.verse: And just as we bore the image of the one made of dust, we shall also bear the image of the heavenly One.

50.verse: Behold, I Tell You a Mystery: We Will Not All Die, But We Will All Conquer Death - Now I say this, brothers: that flesh and blood are not able to inherit the kingdom of God, nor does decay inherit undecayability.

51.verse: Behold, I tell you a mystery: we will not all fall-asleep. But we will all be changed—

52.verse: in a moment, in the blink of an eye, at the last trumpet. For it will trumpet, and the dead will be raised undecayable, and we will be changed.

53.verse: For this decayable body must put-on undecayability, and this mortal body must put on immortality.

54.verse: And when this decayable body puts-on undecayability, and this mortal body puts on immortality, then the saying having been written will come-about: “Death was swallowed-up in victory” [Isa 25:8].

55.verse: “Death, where is your victory? Death, where is your stinger?” [Hos 13:14].

56.verse: Now the stinger of death is sin, and the power of sin is the Law.

57.verse: But thanks be to God, the One giving us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.

58.verse: So Abound In The Work of The Lord; Your Labor Is Not In Vain - So then my beloved brothers, be steadfast, immovable, always abounding in the work of the Lord, knowing that your labor is not empty in the Lord.

1.verse: Concerning The Collection For Jerusalem: Store Up Your Gift And Be Ready When I Come - Now concerning the collection for the saints, just as I directed in the churches of Galatia, so you do also.

2.verse: Every first day of the week, let each of you put-aside beside himself, storing-up whatever thing he may be prospered, in-order-that when I come, collections might not be taking place at-that-time.

3.verse: And when I arrive, whomever you approve, I will send these ones with letters to carry-forth your grace-gift to Jerusalem.

4.verse: And if it is fitting that I also go, they will go with me.

5.verse: I Will Stay In Ephesus For Now, And Come To You Before Winter - Now I will come to you whenever I go through Macedonia, for I am going through Macedonia.

6.verse: And perhaps I will continue with you, or even spend-the-winter, in order that you may send me forward wherever I may go.

7.verse: For I do not want to see you now in passing, for I am hoping to stay with you for some time, if the Lord permits.

8.verse: But I will stay-on in Ephesus until Pentecost,

9.verse: for a great and effective door has opened to me, and there are many opposing.

10.verse: Timothy May Come Before Me: Take Care of Him - But if Timothy comes, see that he may come-to-be with you fearlessly. For he is working the work of the Lord as I also.

11.verse: Therefore let no one treat him with contempt. And send him forward in peace in order that he may come to me, for I am waiting-for him with the brothers.

12.verse: Concerning Apollos: He Will Come When He Can - Now concerning Apollos our brother, I strongly urged him that he come to you with the brothers. And it was not at all his will that he come now, but he will come whenever he finds-an-opportunity.

13.verse: Closing Exhortations And Greetings - Keep-watching, be standing-firm in the faith, be acting-like-men, be growing-strong,

14.verse: let all your things be done in love.

15.verse: And I exhort you, brothers— you know the household of Stephanas, that it is the firstfruit of Achaia, and they appointed themselves for ministry to the saints—

16.verse: that you also be subject to such ones, and to everyone helping and laboring.

17.verse: Now I am rejoicing over the coming of Stephanas and Fortunatus and Achaicus, because these ones filled-up your lack.

18.verse: For they refreshed my spirit and yours. Therefore be acknowledging such ones.

19.verse: The churches of Asia greet you. Aquila and Prisca greet you earnestly in the Lord, along with the church at their house.

20.verse: All the brothers greet you. Greet one another with a holy kiss.

21.verse: The greeting of Paul by my own hand—

22.verse: if anyone does not love the Lord, let him be accursed. Marana tha.

23.verse: The grace of the Lord Jesus be with you.

24.verse: My love be with you all in Christ Jesus.
